t: Lou Reed Vinyl Records — Dutch Vinyl Record Store

t: Amazon.com: Mistrial: CDs & Vinyl
s: When Lou hits his solo on "Video Violence," it's raw and dirty and nasty as it should be. The drum programming (!) on "No Money Down" merits the same respect, as do the mild moments that mark "Don't Hurt a Woman." Don't get me wrong, there's lots to care about here: from the news (Video Violence) to the condemnation of the art scene (Mama's Got A Lover), this record rocks. It examines the impact of these things on society, in Reed...
